alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 17 at 3:36AM CDT until June 17 at 6:30AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Adams County in west central Illinois... Brown County in west central Illinois... * Until 630 AM CDT. * At 336 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Quincy Regional Airport, Mount Sterling, Camp Point, Mendon, Clayton, Golden, Buckhorn, La Grange, Liberty, Versailles, Richfield, Loraine, Woodville, Lima, Coatsburg, Mound Station, Columbus, Ripley, La Prairie and Kellerville. This includes the following State Parks... Siloam Springs State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
